alert.note: Alert for Central Willamette Valley (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 04 at 5:57AM PST until January 08 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Watch is extended for the following rivers in Oregon... Pudding River at Aurora affecting Greater Portland Metro Area and Central Willamette Valley zones. S Yamhill River at McMinnville affecting Central Willamette Valley zone. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...S Yamhill River at McMinnville. * WHEN...From Friday morning to Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Above 50.0 feet, expect lowland flooding at several locations along the river from McMinnville to the confluence with the Willamette River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 AM PST Tuesday the stage was 36.6 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached by Friday. - Flood stage is 50.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 400 PM PST.
